name: save-pixels
description: Saves an ndarray as an image to a file
readme: save-pixels =========== Saves an ndarray to an image. Example ======= ```javascript var zeros = require("zeros") var savePixels = require("save-pixels") //Create an image var x = zeros([32, 32]) x.set(16, 16, 255) //Save to a file savePixels(x, "png").pipe(process.stdout) ``` This writes the foll owing image to stdout: Install ======= npm install save-pixels ### `require("save-pixels")(array, type)` Saves an ndarray as an image with the given format * `array` is an `ndarray` of pixels. Assumes that shape is `[rows, columns, channels]` * `type` is the type of the image to save. Currently supported formats: + `"png"` - Portable Network Graphics format + `"canvas"` - A canvas element **Returns** A stream that you can pipe to serialize the result. # Credits (c) 2013 Mikola Lysenko.
